Description: Two fragments from a cup of fine marlware pottery, comprising the base and a portion of one side. There is a thin projecting rim with a slight ridge below. The wall of the cup is very thin (3mm) and the fabric is a hard grey homogenous clay with minimal inclusions.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxv, 63)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.90, fig.1, p.93, p.98, p.104, p.192, pl.34)
